description: Genotype 5,586 tissue samples collected over the past few years via routine sampling at Burns Creek weir from 2018-2021. All the samples collected at the weir in 2016 and 2017 have been genotyped and the findings are detailed Hargrove et al. (2021). Genotyping these additional samples from 2018-2021 would make it possible to expand our PBT baseline, perform parentage analysis on wild returning adults, determine adult sex ratios through time, and identify reproductive behaviors over 5 spawn years (e.g., repeat spawning). Furthermore, these genetic data could be used to document trends in levels of genetic diversity and effective population size.
title: South Fork Snake River Yellowstone Cutthroat Burns Creek Parentage Analysis
